content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Going straight to the point.ProsThe simulation is extremely real;The array of equipment is pretty vast;It is totally free to play;The graphics and the sounds are really detailed;Fishing feels very rewarding;Fine progression;Really fun, for those who like fishing, to play.ConsThe game only teaches you how to play with floating rods (there are other equipment which you need to learn by yourself and the game doesn't give you a single tip on what it does or how to use it);Some items on store need a specific kind of reel and the game doesn't tell you when it is needed;Frame desynchronization problems;If you lag, or your connection with the game stops, or if the server stops, there's no message telling you that it happened (when the connection is offline fishes don't come for the bait/lure);If you run out of virtual money you'll have to buy it with real money;Some lures can't be attached to certain rods and the game doesn't tell which ones.In general, the game is damn good, if you like fishing simulators or fishing you MUST play it. Wouldn't suggest spending real money on its beta current state because it feels very defective for a beta test, once things get solved and corrected I think the game will have great value.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								I can't get this to work.  I installed and reinstalled it two times.  It keeps crashing on the account create page.  I have a socket 2011 v3 i7 5820K, 32gb of 2666mhz ddr4 ram, 500gb ssd boot drive, two 3 tb sata drives in stripe raid for data.   Plenty enough to run this.  Also a GTX 980 SC video card.  Windows 10 Enterprise Edition.I did not get to play it so I can't really reveiw it properly.EDIT:I got it to work.  I had to uninstall all the nvidia drivers and nvidia expierience  etc...  all nvidia programs in my programs list.  Then rebooted and ran CCleaner and deleted all the nvidia remains.  Then redownloaded and reinstalled the latest driver.  Removed Nvidia Geforce Expierience and the Nvidia Sound Driver.  Now the game works fine on high settings.  I played for a while and it seems ok for early access.  I will test it out more.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Honestly, I was skeptical at first having bought into dovetail games fishing and just plain disliking that, but this game was a pleasant suprise. I'm an avid fisherman and haven't been out much this year because I'm a full time college student (summer classes too...). This game has scratched that itch and will continue to do so every winter when I just want to be out bass fishing. It's early access, so I assume things will only improve from here on out, but it's a solid game. The graphics are awesome, fighting with a fish seems awesome (except when you yank a small fish out of the water and it flies around you...but it's a laugh at least), and the sheer number of items is impressive. I personally dislike that it's the type of game that deals with in game purchases and such, but the game is totally playable without spending a dime. Getting started until you reach level 3-4 is a bit of a grind, but after then is when the game truly becomes fun. The community is great, I get into discussions about all sorts of things and we help each other with game tips. All in all, it's a great experience and it's a relaxing break from your regular day to day. I definitely recommend this game to any fishing fan.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best fishing game I've ever played and It's not even a finished product. It's great fun right now to learn new areas and gear. It has a few bugs but at the rate the devs are fixing them I wouldn't say it's something we will need to worry about in the long run. If you like fishing games then you have to give this a chance, it can be a little difficult at first but people in the in-game chat are helpful and there are great guides available. I can't wait to see how the game evolves and grows over time! There is no hint of pay to win at all, I would gladly pay money for the free game!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Here is my opinion of the game in it's current state. Graphics are really nice the trees are nice and has a nice nature feel to the game. The fishing starting out is a lot of bluegill and crappie. The gameplay mechanics are good except sometimes lag messes you up on fish. I see a lot of complaining about load times. I have not noticed anything abnormal about load times with my system anyway. I have seen a lot about errors and such...again I have not gotten this at all so far. Currently it is bobber fishing if you are after catfish and such however I read that bottom fishing will be added later on. In my honest opinion the price point for premium is a bit expensive for a year. Would be much more reasonable at $60 per year or something equal to what you would pay for each game release that releases on a year to year basis. Premium is not required never the less. But it will certainly take time to level up without it. My main complaint is the size of the trophy fish. They run quite small for most species I have seen. Where I am from a 15lb channel is not out of the realm at all. Bass also seem on the low side of what I would consider a trophy. I do hope this gets rectified in the future.The fish graphics are pretty nice as well!Game is certainly worth playing but will get better in the future. It does have some issues but nothing that can't be dealt with.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								In the year 3036 there is only fish. What scattered remnants of man remain claw at a meager existence sucking nourishment from the prelapsarian cousins of the Earth's finned masters. Welcome to Fish Planet, fish or DIE.Pros: Beautiful visuals, good sound. Incredible attention to detail on gear, fish and environment. Fishing rods, reels, and lures play completely differently befitting a "sim". True free to play. It's a fishing game.Cons: Early Access means less features right now. Occasional fail to load. Occasional crashes.If you've never played a fishing game or haven't played since Super Black Bass on the SNES. Do yourself a favor and download this game for free. I can't wait for a multiplayer mode where you fish next to your buddies.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Very customizable even in early access, and looks to be adding a ton more content. Soothing graphics and calming music. Quite realistic and has a lot of game depth. I really enjoy the contrast of this slower paced, zen game compared to a lot of the action packed and hecked clickers in most f2p games. (The other stuff is great too, but sometimes I just wanna calm down a little.) It's also great to play while catching up on Netflix or watching Twitch. There are purchasable in-game items and DLC, but I personally haven't bought any, so I cant really comment on that. The devs have said that there is nothing locked behind pay walls, so it should be pretty fair. Will have to see in later development. My only negative is that the pace is a little slow right now. I seem stuck at rank 2, but that may be becasue 'm just not putting in the hours. Anyways, what is available now is quite good, content is a bit limited for lower levels, but there is at least several hours of good gameplay in there regardless, and I definently find mylsef coming back to it when I just want something quieter to play after a long day. I can't wait for the game to develop and grow.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Going straight to the point.ProsThe simulation is extremely real;The array of equipment is pretty vast;It is totally free to play;The graphics and the sounds are really detailed;Fishing feels very rewarding;Fine progression;Really fun, for those who like fishing, to play.ConsThe game only teaches you how to play with floating rods (there are other equipment which you need to learn by yourself and the game doesn't give you a single tip on what it does or how to use it);Some items on store need a specific kind of reel and the game doesn't tell you when it is needed;Frame desynchronization problems;If you lag, or your connection with the game stops, or if the server stops, there's no message telling you that it happened (when the connection is offline fishes don't come for the bait/lure);If you run out of virtual money you'll have to buy it with real money;Some lures can't be attached to certain rods and the game doesn't tell which ones.In general, the game is damn good, if you like fishing simulators or fishing you MUST play it. Wouldn't suggest spending real money on its beta current state because it feels very defective for a beta test, once things get solved and corrected I think the game will have great value.

								This is a fun game, better than I expected. The graphics are very good, and the amount of features in game is fantastic. You can change reels, buy new bait, choose from different locations to fish at. It is very realistic, and you will be surprised about how much fun you can have with this game. However, sometimes the screen shakes so much the game becomes unplayable. This first happened for me after completing the tutorial. It shakes so bad it hurts your eyes-forcing you to exit the game. Please fix this issue so the game becomes easy to use again.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a great sim.  Very educational, great mature community.  The game progresses at a good, steady pace, with new achievements appearing every play.  I used to think fishing was all about chance, but this game is very skill-based: if you use different techniqe you will catch entirely different fish even in the same pond.  It inspires me to go out into the real world and fish, something I never would have considered before, so obviously this is an excellent game, even if it is made by Russians.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								A free-to-play, always online game that looks great, has an always-online feature with servers that are only occasionally down for patches and maintanence, has gameplay that will be enjoyable for the niche gamers it clearly appeals to, and it doesn't even try to force microtransactions down your throat via mental manipulation (they're still there if you want to support the devs, though).(UPDATE) Although a large part of the game is grinding out levels to get better equipment/locations, the game becomes vastly more enjoyable once you reach higher levels and are able to catch (relatively) massive fish.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Fishing since a long time, I really find this game great and so promising.Strike are really realistic, and you can guess what fish it will be from it. Fish behavior is also well simulated. The dev support is really top, and even if there is still some bugs (it's still Early Access and what game did not ? ), they react fast, take users feedback into account, and keep their promise.If you have fishing experience, try it, if you don't but want to discover this great sport, try it also : it's FREE (you really can start without paying a cent, and if you love this game you will want to pay for it).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								In the year 3036 there is only fish. What scattered remnants of man remain claw at a meager existence sucking nourishment from the prelapsarian cousins of the Earth's finned masters. Welcome to Fish Planet, fish or DIE.Pros: Beautiful visuals, good sound. Incredible attention to detail on gear, fish and environment. Fishing rods, reels, and lures play completely differently befitting a "sim". True free to play. It's a fishing game.Cons: Early Access means less features right now. Occasional fail to load. Occasional crashes.If you've never played a fishing game or haven't played since Super Black Bass on the SNES. Do yourself a favor and download this game for free. I can't wait for a multiplayer mode where you fish next to your buddies.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								I can't get this to work.  I installed and reinstalled it two times.  It keeps crashing on the account create page.  I have a socket 2011 v3 i7 5820K, 32gb of 2666mhz ddr4 ram, 500gb ssd boot drive, two 3 tb sata drives in stripe raid for data.   Plenty enough to run this.  Also a GTX 980 SC video card.  Windows 10 Enterprise Edition.I did not get to play it so I can't really reveiw it properly.EDIT:I got it to work.  I had to uninstall all the nvidia drivers and nvidia expierience  etc...  all nvidia programs in my programs list.  Then rebooted and ran CCleaner and deleted all the nvidia remains.  Then redownloaded and reinstalled the latest driver.  Removed Nvidia Geforce Expierience and the Nvidia Sound Driver.  Now the game works fine on high settings.  I played for a while and it seems ok for early access.  I will test it out more.

Also, the game has a really great community, so if you ever need help, you can just ask other players in game and there is always people willing to help you out. So, all in all, I wold give this game an 11/10 for anyone who loves fishing.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								After a day of strressful work (or stressful gaming) this an incredibly satisfying, yet relaxing casual fishing simulator.  I have not played too many fishing sims but I have played enough to find this one far more enjoyable.If you are highly competitive even in your casual gaming you will probably not find this appealing at the moment.  Multiplayer exists and the community is really great -- but there are no tournaments and you're left with a leader board for each fishing location but nothing super special.And of course if you are super competitive you will be frustrated by the DLC and micro transactions.  When approached from the perspective of a casual game, I find the micro transactions to be distateful but much less bothersome.As with most fishing sims, you are of course rewarded more for catching the "popular kids" of the sport fishing world (Bass, Salmon, Pike ect ect) but you are still able to progress/level with trout, catfish and panfish.  They are actually how I grabbed some decent ingame cash early on though they fade in importance over time.The graphics are enjoyable but at the moment the software is certainly not optimized.  I regularly have minor (read: non-game breaking) graphical errors.  The sound track is peaceful and enjoyable as well.  In short, if you want to actually feel like you're really fishing with complicated sporting gear in the actual environment...you need to purchase a fishing license and go out side.  But if you're interested in casually gaming and like fishing this is not a bad option and honestly one of the best currently availabe (though that says so little).

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you like actual fishing, you will like this game.  Very realistic, beautiful scenery and sound effects.  You need to learn and use different techniques to catch fish in this game, I'm certain I've learned quite a bit for the next time I go to drown some worms in real life.You won't find announcer's voices or underwater views or any of that stuff.  You're holding a rod, watching the tension of the line or the bobber.  Just like real life.The DLC is a little pricey, but you can earn and purchase all sorts of gear totally from in-game cash, if you're willing to grind a little.  Once you get past a certain level and purchase the right tackle you can start to get the ball rolling. Free.A very relaxing and fun game.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								I went into the water to drink and bathe in the river, to get the smell of the fish so they would accept me into their fold. Slowly and surely I gained their trust, and adopted their language, culture, and ways. The great chief look to me as the next leader for the tribe, and I already gained the love of his daughter. Soon I was caught between two worlds, my fellow fishermen or my new fishy brethen. I went to consult the source of wisdom for the fish, the great and powerful submerged river truck tire. It spoke to me of a war that will come to take the lives of my fish tribe, and the evil of man and their great machines of war. What will happen to me I do not know, but this game is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome if you love fishing.10/10 Half fish, half man babies

content:
Posted: September 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game is good but buggy at times...  To be honest my biggest complaint is that my camera view keeps getting off center after about an hour of playing and I have to quit and restart.  The fish don't act like normal fish at times.  When you try to catch the fish they are much smarter than normal fish in that they can rapidly create slack on the line and get off the hook unnaturally fast.  It's fine for now and it's still a good game.  After playtesting the game for a few days I have a few recommendations for the game to make it's replay ability better.  It would be more exciting if you could walk around the lake and have to find the fishing spots.  Seasons should also be introduced in order to change fishing style throughout the 4 season.  Fly fishing should be included in the game.  Also the lakes should be larger and different boats should be introduced in order to access locations unavailable by foot.  I would also spread the experience across the fish more so that players don't go for the same fish all the time.  It seems that at each lake there is only one fish that gives a good amount of experience while the rest don't give enough experience to make them worth fishing.  I know the game isn't finished and these are only suggestions to the developers....Other than that the game is great with a lot of potential.  Definitely worth playing for a while.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								Highly recommended for people that has given up all hope in life and does not mind staring at a pointless computer screen for endless hours. Here's for all you good folks out there that has caught a fish, this amazing salmon recipe will help a lot with your future endeavours.  1 (2 pound) salmon fillet 1 teaspoon lemon-pepper seasoning 1 teaspoon onion salt 1 small onion, sliced and separated into rings 6 slices lemon 1/4 cup butter, cut into small chunks  1/3 cup sour cream 1/3 cup mayonnaise 1/4 cup dry white wine 1 tablespoon capers 1 tablespoon finely chopped onion 1 tablespoon caper brine 1 teaspoon lemon juice 1 teaspoon prepared horseradish 3/4 teaspoon dried dill weed 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt ground black pepper to taste1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil; grease the foil lightly.2. Place salmon fillet with skin side down on foil. Season salmon with lemon-pepper and onion salt; top with onion rings                   and lemon slices, dot with butter. Fold foil around salmon and seal tightly.3. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Unseal the foil and turn the oven's broiler on. Continue cooking the salmon under the broiler until the flesh flakes easily with a fork, 8 to 12 minutes.4. While the salmon bakes, stir sour cream, mayonnaise, white wine, capers, chopped onion, caper brine, lemon juice, horseradish, dill weed, garlic salt, and black pepper together in a bowl. Serve with the salmon.

Early Access Review
								Fishing Planet is a Early Access Free to Play realistic sportsfishing simulator made for anglers.  You will have to know how to fish for real and love fishing for real.   You can catch 8 fish families.  The graphics look good but the background music is repetative.  You have a lot of control of how you set up your fishing gear and control on using your fishing gear.  Like real fishing, the environment conditions is supposed to effect the fishing.You get for free 1 unlimited basic licence in Missouri, the Missouri map has 2 locations.  But you have invisible walls preventing you from moving away from the location or falling into water.  Looks like you can unlock other fishing trips after grinding through trips in Missouri, you have to level up and earn ingame credits.  There are 6 other fishing trips, currently locked. If you buy a premium pack it gives you licences, give you some credits and a xp boost, and you can buy credit bundles with real money.  You can get licenses and gear using ingame credits.  You can earn some ingame credits and gold by playing.  If you go broke, game over, so make sure you make your trips profitable.  Maybe someone could learn how to fish for real playing this game well.  I don't like fishing, did only a little fishing when real young, so i am going by what i know watching fishing tv shows i seen.  It looked ok and game worked, has a beginning tutorial.for more info:

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you like to fish, but don't like having to travel, get wet, get cold, and get smelly old fish guts all over you, this is a fine simulation of real fishing. I believe they are going to introduce many more aspects such as boats, co-op, European fish (and hopefully European pegs!) and maybe sea fishing...here's hoping! It's free to play and you can earn not only the normal in-game currency, but also the special coinage by doing events and catching Unique fish. There's really no downside to trying this game, the scenery, beautifully rendered streams, rivers and lakes all help to relax after a hard days mutant or zombie killing. Go on, wind up your day by winding down and winding in a fish or two! :)

Early Access Review
								i can understand that this game is a free 2 play. but the progression is extremly slow.i watched a few youtube videos about how to catch specific fish and what not.and ye they give you more than +1 star (aka exp.) but still it takes you forever to level up to level 3.i am sure, with the premium (booster) thing, it wouldnt go alot faster.also i can understand that the progression in this game is slower cause it may take you up to 10-15 or even more minutes till u actually catch a fish.but even if i get a punch of 1.6 pounds -catfishes (+7 stars) it still takes quiet a long time to level up.it wouldnt be a big deal if u would get a new map/location if u level to level 3 since it takes you atleast 1-2h to get to level 3, if u are new and got no idea what u are doing.but no, (not completly sure) u need level 6 to get the second location, which is new york.other than the really slow progression, the game is really sweet. fun and addicting!i would love to see other players around the river fishing aswell. currently all you can do is chat with ppl on your server. thats not how an MMO works :(also running around more would be really fun aswell, dont give us just a few spawns and we can walk 2meters to the water and stay there the whole day.u should be able to only choose one spawn, which will be next to your car and than u can walk 10-20sec to the river (shortest way) or you can walk all around the river and fish from the other side :Ddont get me wrong, i dont want a walking simulator, just more possibilitys on where i can fish rather than a "hardcoded" area.looking forward for updates :)

Posted: December 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								this game is not broken its far better than it was back in august and it will only get betternow im not saying its perfect cos its far from that there is a lot of bugs about atm theres dissapeering fish,flying fish even raining fish :D theres a problem with the drag on a few real big fish,theres walking fish.the wear system is fine if you keep your gear in the green area there is hardly any wear but if you go for bigger fish and have to go in the red then repair is more(nothing wrong with that)but even with all these negatives the game is more fun than ever once you relearn itfish fights are awsome now,the fish ai is a lot better(they actualy react to how you move the rod ect)i think the main problem is its no more easyland the biger fish take a lot more effort to land and i love that.Even the smaller fish are far better now, go grab a ultra light setup 0.8 braid and a nano spinner and go origon i dare you to say its not funn :D to me is seems to many focus on the monster fish in game put town your big guns and go have some fun with the smaller stuff forget about xp grindin and start actualy fishing :Dany 1 that actualy knows me knows i spend more time at the lower lvl places than i do at the good places and im lvl 23.Theres going to be lots more bugs,lots more changes before this game gets out of early access and i will be here for all of them becouse i love the game and realy enjoy it.you can call me a fanboy i dont realy give a toss im in for the long haul,i will be here throu all the good times and the bad becouse this is a fantastic game a great dev team(a bit slow but hey there not a big team) and a fantastic comunity.now go dipp your wick,get ya line wet, tight lines all :D

content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								It's a pretty fun game in the few hours I have played. The graphics are pretty, and the fishing is fun once I figured out what I was doing. It does have a few rough patches like all early access games do though. The weather pattern in the different fishing spots is exactly the same each 'trip' and I think a bit more variety would be nice. I also am one of those people who uses a keyboard layout other than the standard US QWERTY, and it would be nice if I could re-bind controlls to the keys I actually have, or if there was controller support. That and a few glitches like being unable to reliably set up your rod when buying new gear is annoying.On the bright side though, it is free!

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								As an older bloke but still relatively new to online gaming, I was sick and tired of the shoot em ups I normally play and sought something more relaxing. Due to my disability, I have not been fishing in the real world for years, so when I stumbled across this game in steam, for free, well I just had to give it a go. And I am very glad I did.It is so relaxing to play. I love the scenery, I love the way some of the smaller fish can put up a great fight. The background sound effects are lovely. And I really enjoy the friendly banter in the on screen chat box. If you are the kind of gamer that likes to compete with others, you can play it that way and try to level up as quick as you can, and there a tons of guides to help you find the tricks and tips, I however, really enjoy the slower route, figuring things out for myself, and just enjoying the game for what it is. A marvelous way to relax and recuperate from my recent heart attack, and a smashing alternative to the find gun, load gun, kill em all type of game that I have been playing up untill now.A truly brilliant game, thank you to all the Dev's, for making this, and releasing it for free. Brilliant. 10 out of 10 from me.

								Did any one not notice this game is in early release. And FREE and yes there will be bugs and it will crash and not work from time to time and the dev team may get things wrong as in making game worse before it gets better at times. As thats the idea of early release game. Not for us to slate it but to be constructive with your criticism and help the dev team to make game better. if when game is released and may even be charged for game then thats when you go this game is not for me the dev team have got it wrong for me i am not playing any more job done. But for now this is looking to being a good game and i am having fun playing now yes at times it feels a bit same as you catch fish in the same loctions time and time again. But the quetion is despite the bugs the crashes and all the other problems with game as its in DEVELOPMENT not a finished producted yet. Is it fun do i enjoy playing it well my answer is yes i played nothing much else since coming across the game a few days ago. Does it do my head in at times when it does not work as i think it should or can't catch big fish yes but thats the part i am enjoying and for a person who hates fishing in real life i dont think thats bad thing. So would i recomend the game yes a big yes because its free for one it can be a bit of a grind but not as much as real fishing in my opinion as i hate real fishing lol. Secondly it looks nice and sounds not bad few more back ground noise would be nice and change more and get rid of mosies lol. So try it if you dont like nothing lost as it has not cost you any thing. Is a full product i would say not but it is looking to be one great game at moment needs work and i feel thats what its all about :) SO STOP MOANING AND STOP PLAYING OR HELP MAKE GAME BETTER with constructive criticism not game bashing or game bashing as i have read in various posts. Also on release if game is not what you wanted for it stop playing and dont pay if it becomes a payed game.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Summary:Played a couple hours and overall a pretty decent game. It is a little different from fishing games I remember playing in the past but it's not bad. At the start it was a bit annoying having the control map pop up while the tutorial was going. I think that it should have been less invasive and have a little bubble stating "press F1 for controls" or something like that. Also the control map has some faded lines pointing to the keys which are a bit hard to follow. I kind of feel like a noob but just a suggestion... If you catch a fish that is supposed to be a release under the license equipped maybe once you catch that restricted fish it should have a notice that fades away saying if you keep the fish you'll get fined. I messed up and kept 2 fish in New York on a basic license and it made me go negative and now I can't fish til tomorrow. I can see this game getting a little repetative over time once I have caught a majority of the fish. Otherwise it's pretty relaxing, just throw some music on in the background grab a beer (age 21+) kick back and cast out.Pros:Beautiful graphicsVariety of gear/fish/methods to catch themCommunication to others in server (chatting and notifications of fish caught)Cons:Looking around/movement is a bit floatyNeeds more clarity on license restrictions real timeI'll do a better review when I get more time in the game and have more knowledge about the game.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I would overwhelmingly recommend this game, here is why...I've played many fishing games dating back to Blue Marlin on the NES. This game is the first one that has ever given me a sense of what it is truly like to fish in real life. The environment is beautiful, the equipment realistic, the difficulties of real fishing are present. There are two types of players in this game, the first type goes into it to play a game, the other goes into it to fish. The developers need both types of players to be a success. The game can't be too realistic to where you can play for a few hours and catch nothing, but it also can't be so easy that it feels 'arcadey', because you will lose the players that come to fish. If you want to catch a fish then you can, but if you want to catch a nice fish you will have to work for it, just like real life fishing. There are mechanics occasionally that make it hard to catch fish, but a game that is still early access and is this complex needs leeway to fine tune things.There are many people that play this game that are in the first group and do not care about learning how to fish, they just want to know where to cast, what to cast with, and what time of day, then they try and can't catch what they were going for and blame the game or the developers. If you take the time to experiment with different lures, different retrieve styles, and cast in places that real fish would hang out then you will catch something, it may take some practice, it may take some persistence, and it will take patience. That is one key thing that makes this game worth my time, the idea that real fishing requires patience, if you don't have that and you wait 5 seconds and nothing will hit your bobber and you get mad and bash the game then you aren't meant to play this game.On the topic of cheaters, a lot of people say that since there are cheaters in the game, that it ruins their experience. I really don't see how they can do that. One person cheating doesn't change my experience because I can still come into the game and catch a fish, I know how I caught that fish and I can take pride in the fact that I didn't have to cheat to get that fish. The devs have done a lot to curb cheating and sometimes those measures can have false positives. Anti-cheat is a very hard thing to get right and will never be 100% effective. I will admit that this game can get quite grindy in the higher levels. The official reason for that is so that it will take you longer to do everything there is to do and catch so that the devs have more time to add more content to keep you coming back. But I have been playing for 510hrs at the time I am writing this review and I have yet to catch everything I want to catch and go everywhere I want to go, however I am slightly slower than some. Some say this game is pay to play and it is most definitely not, far from it. I have not paid a single cent to get to where I am, but not that I won't in the future to support the game. Yes you need certain gear to be able to participate in certain areas but you do not need to pay real money to do it. There is a reason why certain maps are level locked and its because you can't start out in the game and immediately go after a 50 pound striper bass or a 40 pound Northern Pike. You start out with access to gear that are only rated for small fish. Its a game, you work up to the big ones, if you don't like that don't play. Some recent reviews are complaining about that because there were limited time events that opened up all the lakes to everyone so they could compete in a tournament for fish anyone can catch. But they chose to go for fish they didn't have the gear to catch. Obviously you can pay for DLC and get better gear early and beable catch any fish that you have the level to catch, such as the 90 pound gar in Missouri. But, that is far from being pay to win because you can just wait till you level up and you can get that gear for in-game currency.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Trophy Bass 4 >>>>> current state of Fishing Planetedit - after 17 hours or so i'll say this... and i still stand by my initial review... the actual "fishing" mechanics of the game is OK so far. at it's base it's fun. but what makes it boring? shore fishing. it gets old pretty fast from static points. there needs to be boats, topographic maps, electronics, etc. i doubt we'll see it on a scale like trophy bass 4 where entire real lakes are mapped and you could travel to any point on it.the "grind" to use gear is fairly boring. it also feels like the fish Quality scales to lures you unlock. maybe there's some RNG involved to get trophies on worse things but i havent seen it yet. also the semi-forced "you must fish varied species" to level quicker is pretty Carrot on a Stick. im interested in bass fishing only. you should be able to grind the game fishing how YOU want to fish ("you can just way slower because one lake doesnt have a species you want to fish"). combining lures and different types of rigging... why use anything but jigs with hook guards for cover fishing? why can't i make a jig-n-pig combo? i can't texas rig my worms or tubes. what if you want to wacky rig? more casts... the casting is too generic. there needs to be flips, skips, etc, etc... a game made in 2000 has all of this - even if the graphics are way crappier it's a way more fleshed out game that creates a better experience of fishing simulation. "ultimate" fishing simulator is a very bold claim for what it's offering.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								Absolutely a fun game to play for a bit to kill time or to sit down and relax with some fishing. Alot of people are complaining about the fishing mechanics of the game and others things, it's free to play and simulation games (especially ones like these) are hard to get all the mechanics down. The game has to pay attention to so many factors to try and replicate real fishing which is very demanding. So the fact that many people think the game is broke or too easy there's a few simple things you can do1. Post actual problems in the forum rather than QQ because you can't fish right.2. Remember that the game is still in early dev so there is going to be problems, get over it.2. Uninstall and move on. It's not a game for everyone and it's f2p so you're not loosing anything.Overall mechanics are solid to play, different baits to use so there plenty of variety, many updates that come out everyday to improve.Will rate it 8.5-9/10 for simulators.

content:
Posted: April 3
Early Access Review
								This game changed the way I live drastically. Now, I will acknowledge that it appears I only have approximately six minutes played on Fishing Planet, but let me be honest: Those six minutes were damn well near the best six minutes of my life. I changed from an isolated and depressed 30-year-old man with an anime body pillow into a 30-year-old virtual fishing master with no time to be distracted by my animated girlfriend. The simple, yet elegant act of catching virtual fish encouraged me to contemplate my life and motivated me to abandon my sweet high-school waifu and become a competitive E-Sports fisherman. I was an atheist until I played this game; I'm now a firm believer of Christ and this game is a clear reincarnation of him. I have achieved a state of Nirvana. I am God.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of all, the game is very promising, not just there yet, but has potential of being the best Fishing Simulator so far. But let's check the pros and consPros:- Not just a game, a super realistic simulation- Fully customizable equipment from rods&reels to your hat&boots- Many ways to fish, many places to fish- Again, realistic gameplay forces LICENSES (awesome!)- Good visuals- A really helpful communityCons:- Good graphics brings lag from time to time (though I tried the game after a Starcraft II marathon that lasted over 40 hours, so gotta check it out later.)- F1 Controls Panel is too messy that I closed it right away and asked the community for most of controls- Tutorial? Is there any? I mean "Throw the bait using LMB *LMB image*" Thanks mate! Reallly helpful it was. I was about stick rod right up to my a**.-Uhm... I thought this was Multiplayer? I thought it was, Co-Operative? No? Oh... Seriously only thing that looks Multi-Player is the chat-box. Th game promises to have some tournaments but... C'mon WE WANNA THROW THE THINGY TOGETHER!!!Overall, this game is good, looks good, will be even better! 'cuz the game is already good, you can see it in the "pros" section up there and it's "cons" stated above are al fixable cons. Highly, seriously recommended. I don't know how to wait for my computer to relax a bit to play this game under better circumstances. Add me, message me and blah blah blah-di blah.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								I found this gem after watching a livestream and was very interested. As an avid outdoorsman and fishermen, I wanted to see what a F2P game had to offer. While it is still in early access, it is still a very fun game to play. Tons of content and more still to come. Travel America fishing for the premier freshwater fish. From pan fish to bass, predatory fish, float fishing, trout, salmon, and even the mighty sturgeon, this game is an easy and fun way  to fish if you've never been or do it all the time. As in real life, spending money on stuff that you may never use is a bad move. Before buying, ask yourself, will I need this after Missouri, or Colorado, or New York(btw don't go here after you unlock it, its a bad move, wait until you are higher level or you will be in debt and get stuck. 8.5/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have never fished in real life... I have never been interested in fishing...Then I was introduced to this game.. At first I was like OK this is boring but then after leveling up and catching different types of fishes I got hooked (pun intended).  Really fun game and I've actually learned alot. And I can happily say that this game is so satisfying I never ever have to go fishing IRL.When fishing in the game it actually sounds like I'm at a real river or lake. Sometimes there is annoying little birds or whatever making noise and irritates me. But it sounds very real. The maps are very beautiful.. Lovely little mountains on some... Just trees on others. One map i really like is Florida. Looks amazing.There is a nice variety of fishies and the best one imo is the Walleye.So far a very good game!! Cant wait til they add more maps (EU SOON!!) and more fishies :D

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Logged in not having a huge amount of hope for this game, having played just about every sports hunting and fishing game made at least a few hours. By the time I stepped up to the bank I was swatting mosquitoes away from my ears. This game is very good for a fishing sim, if you like that stuff. If you liked other fishing games this one will blow you away. You must use proper baits, depths, rod/reel setups, etc. The immersion is nice too. I spent a evening just cat fishing because it was fun.I would not recommend this to anyone looking for action, or fast paced anything. This game is made to hang out, chill, relax catch a few fish and chat with others doing the same thing.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								A friend of mine was playing this game for about a week telling me I should try it out and I was giving him grief for it the whole time. I like to fish in real life and my thought was "if I want to fish, I'll load up my gear and hit the lake up the road, fishing sim? Whats next? Bathroom sim? Lol" but one day I gave in and downloaded it... WOW!!! Within 5 mins of getting past the tutorial I was hooked. This game is awesome! The graphics are amazing, the fish artwork is fantastic, the map locations, the gear, the fish fights, the community... it's all awesome! And to think, I can go fishing and I dont have to buy bait, gas, or license. I dont have to deal with crowded fishing piers or river banks, summer heat or frigid cold. It is early access so some things are a little buggy but nothing that doesnt take away from the immersion or fun of the game. The Dev team works hard to bring new content and fix problems that the community reports. The community itself is filled with awesome people who will help you out if you dont know the first thing about fishing and video guides are out there for just about every species in game. Good people, good fun, good game! Download and give it a shot, you wont be disappointed. Completely free to play, you get access to everything with ingame credits and gold that you earn by catching fish except for DLC but that is a given. So what are you waiting for? Come join us in the best fishing sim money can't buy.

Posted: December 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you are looking for a fishing simulator, this is the game for you. The visuals are stunning, and the game runs really well, much better than anyone would expect. It's lovely ambience just adds so much depth to the game, and it brings you as close as you can get to actual fishing. It's still in alpha, and the game is already amazing. I can't wait to see what the develepors do with this. To top it all off, it's free! This is a game you don't want to miss out on. 9/10

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								2nd EDIT: After recent patch 3.3 that went live 12th March, I can say that game i enjoy playing this game once again. They have  turned down fish IQ, and they are not able to snag the line anymore. It's turned off until they figure out proper way to do it. Gear still wasn't updated and everyone will find leveling a bit harder because the lack of gear required. One of the examples is lvl 19 casting rod "Galaxycast" that requires lure weight to be minimum 100g. That was obvious typo, and game suffers for it, since you can't really use that rod. Main flaw of the whole update is that devs cranked up the difficulty but haven't provided players with adequate new or updated gear.I still have high hopes for this game.Back from my previous rating when i gave this game 3/10 (post patch) from 9/10 (pre patch), I am now giving this game rating of 6/9 since they have made it playable again. I have my hopes up this will not become "freemium" game.For those who wish to read my review of the patch 3.0 and my thoughts on it, you can find my rant below. :)tl;dr - I explain the reasons why they screwed the last update, and how it hurt the game and community.__________________________________________________________________________________EDIT:Apparently, only their patch notes are really lame. Thing is, you need to match your gear exactly to the weight (or better) of the fish you are going for. My main problem was that the game was lying to me. A bit about the line not fitting reel. If reel says its 0.28, just mount it even if you get warning that it may damage your reel. If you have reel that is even the slightest lower than the fish you are catching you WILL break your gear, and damage it fast. If your full gear matches the fish spec, you will have same experience as before. It WILL become enjoyable again. I will be leaving this negative review tho, since the patch notes are TRASH and i had to spend over 10k and 100g to figure this out.__________________________________________________________________________________There are tons of reasons to love this game. Excellent community, gorgeous scenery, sound effects (tho some peckers and wolves can be annoying at times) the feeling when you are fishing them sometimes "feels" like real fishing. BUT...Reason why i'm even writing this, is because i have spent very much of my spare time on this, and after most recent update, i  had a feeling i have to go and put my 2 cents here. Update is almost perfect. While they were trying to go for feel that would be as much realistic as it can get, somewhere they lost themselves. It has supposed to be tougher for players. To make fish smarter, to make gear have durability, and to make you use your gear as you would do in real life, instead of just straight reeling fish in. Well I said they got lost, because when they went for smart fish, they got smart as Albert Einstein with street smarts and strength of a superman. You can have all proper gear suited for the fish that you are trying to catch, but fish will just glance around see some rocks or weeds, make a run for it, forgetting the fact that it is in much pain and agony get boost of strength and swim 15m in opposite direction, hiding behind those rocks, then tie some super knot around one of those rocks, snag your line, get the hook out if it's mouth and just laugh at you for being a dunce compared to her smarts. Now for the gear wear/tear part. Everything gets destroyed. Your jacket, your bags, lures, lines rods and reels. I'm guessing the undies get worn too. Now, it wouldn't be much of a problem if that would take some time, but alas it is not. Your gear lasts you for 30-40 fish max, then you need to repair it (if you manage to fix it, since reels once snagged by fish at max length because of their superman strength, your reel gets broken full since you can't break line unless prompted, and game doesn't offer you that option. Broke 6 reels trying to fish in California (where i am supposed to fish for my level). At the moment i'm stuck in leveling because i should be fishing in Cali, but my gear (that's the only thing that crossed my mind) is not good enough for that fish. But if i would go anywhere else to fish, i would need to grind another year, since i'm getting 10 times less XP on some other places. For example for rainbow trouts i'm getting 35xp and i need 20.000 xp to my next level. Fishing technique: They did almost flawless job. You need to fish just as you would reel in real fish. You need to tire it out with same techniques that you would use in real life. But again, their smarts and superman strength are sometimes ruining (quite often) the experience. I'm using correct and updated skill (fishing as if i would in real life with tiring the fish), but somehow they always are able to go over my max line distance and break my reels. And anyways, i've got gear at my place that is older than 30 years and still works same as the day it was bought.Now there are also some gear issues that don't make sense to me.  I guess either i'm not right in my assumption, or somehow they missed one thing. I am using  spinning reel Exterminator 5500 for example. As it says on it, it supports 0.28 braided line. Well, it wont support it, and not even 0.23 one. So, how about you fix this ASAP.... game mechanics are a gem. but fish is 3 times stronger than it actually is, gets bursts of power that allow them to swim 40m in opposite direction, and you just can't do nothing. Just sit and watch as it destroys your gear, even tho, your reel in reality should easily handle that fish weight.This game is going FREEMIUM and i think they wont turn away from that idea, since there is already DLC package that you can buy. That dlc includes gear that will be usable for ANY fish. And there is no way to obtain that gear in any other way.YOU NEED FIXES TO THIS UPDATE ASAP, or this is going to end badly with you loosing gamers.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								A friend of mine was playing this game for about a week telling me I should try it out and I was giving him grief for it the whole time. I like to fish in real life and my thought was "if I want to fish, I'll load up my gear and hit the lake up the road, fishing sim? Whats next? Bathroom sim? Lol" but one day I gave in and downloaded it... WOW!!! Within 5 mins of getting past the tutorial I was hooked. This game is awesome! The graphics are amazing, the fish artwork is fantastic, the map locations, the gear, the fish fights, the community... it's all awesome! And to think, I can go fishing and I dont have to buy bait, gas, or license. I dont have to deal with crowded fishing piers or river banks, summer heat or frigid cold. It is early access so some things are a little buggy but nothing that doesnt take away from the immersion or fun of the game. The Dev team works hard to bring new content and fix problems that the community reports. The community itself is filled with awesome people who will help you out if you dont know the first thing about fishing and video guides are out there for just about every species in game. Good people, good fun, good game! Download and give it a shot, you wont be disappointed. Completely free to play, you get access to everything with ingame credits and gold that you earn by catching fish except for DLC but that is a given. So what are you waiting for? Come join us in the best fishing sim money can't buy.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
Early Access Review
Preface: This review is a "compare & contrast" with another popular fishing title released around the same time, Dovetail Games' Euro Fishing. I like both and think they're both quality titles, but they do different things well and will satisfy different tastes. This review is meant to help you decide which one you might prefer. I wrote a similar review for Euro Fishing, and will update both when Fishing Planet comes out of early access.+Free, with a generous FTP model Fishing Planet's FTP model is described on the wiki as "free to win", and while that sounds contrived it really is pretty accurate. Fishing Planet is very generous with what is available to non-paying players, and the devs have stated that they want people to pay to support the game, not because they were forced to in order to progress. Be forewarned that the mid-game can get grindy, but overall I think that Fishing Planet is living up to its FTP intentions.+Nice variety of fishing styles & techniques Even in early access, Fishing Planet has a great variety of angling styles, and it even recognizes different lure presentation techniques within spin fishing. The devs have promised even more styles in the future (including boat and kayak fishing), but Fishing Planet is already a fairly comprehensive US fishing game, with potential to be even greater.+Lots of different places to fish Fishing Planet has locations all over the US, and will include different water types in each (rivers, lakes, marshes, reservoirs etc). The devs have said that an eventual goal is to have locations outside the USA as well. +Great variety of fish Panfish. Crappie. Catfish. Bass. Pike. Trout. Salmon. Gar. Lots of different kinds of fish, and more might be on the way. Such a diverse group of target fish requires lots of different angling methods, giving Fishing Planet a ton of longevity. This variety of angling methods, locations and fish is Fishing Planet's greatest strength against the rather one-dimensional Euro Fishing.+Excellent water effects The water in Fishing Planet is beautiful, which means a lot when you'll spend most of your time in-game staring at it. Personally I love how well it reflects the surrounding environment, and reacts to your line. This is another area where one of FP's strengths aligns against a particular weakness of DTG's Euro Fishing, which struggles a bit with its water.+Tons of gear Geeking out over gear is part of the fun of the hobby, and Fishing Planet really delivers with a large store of real-world fishing toys. One nice nod to immersion is that while you're out fishing, the local shops will have different gear on hand. -Limited spots to fish from in each area Although you can fish all over the US in different kinds of water, each area only gives you a few cramped spots to fish from. There is little room for the exploration found in DTG's Euro Fishing, and each location does feel more like a videogame set piece than a real place. It doesn't take long for each area to feel a little stale.-Weak casting mechanics Click LMB to fill the power bar. Easy, but honestly it's a letdown in comparison to the casting in DTG's Euro Fishing. This is where Fishing Planet falls short against a strength of its European counterpart.-Audio is incomplete, and impedes immersion Fishing Planet is in early access, so hopefully the audio will see some TLC before release. However, at this point it's noticeably incomplete, and hampers the immersive aspects of FP's strong points.-No landing mechanic Currently you just reel the fish in, and there is no mechanic for netting or handling them. One could argue this is better than the pretty rough netting mechanic of Euro Fishing, but hopefully something is added at release. -No photo-op Fishing Planet's presentation of your catch is disappointing. Your character just hangs them in front of your screen by your line, and they flop around until you click through the stats box. DTG's photo-op finish to each catch does a great job of showing off the fish, and helps give them a sense of personality. FP's fish (even the unique ones) end up feeling a bit cookie-cutter and bland. -Multiplayer is a chatroom As a game that bills itself as an MMO, I really expected more than this. The devs have more multiplayer features on the way, but at the moment Fishing Planet is basically a single-player game with a chatroom. DTG's Euro Fishing actually lets you fish with other players in the same location.-Weak NPE (new player experience) Fishing Planet's tutorials are cursory at best, nothing more than a few click-through menus. Hopefully a more comprehensive tutorial is added at launch. However, the wiki is, despite being a work-in-progress, quite good.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'll start with the cons of this simulator, and follow up with the pros.  This is my opinion based on years of playing fishing games and spending countless hours fishing in real life.  (Note: I've read the most recent dev blog post, and it appears that the developers are hard at work already on some of this.  Good stuff!)=== Cons ===Physics - line slack in water doesn't correlate with how much line is released; confusing fish catches (the fish seem to 'fly' or teleport out of the water upon catching).Xbox 360 controller - doesn't feel right with the controls of this game.  No game controller configuration options.Controls - out of sync with fish bites; casting is a pain (no level of casting power?  simply click and hope for the best?); hooking/reeling fish is a confusing ordeal (fish on?  tension?  visual/audio feedback?  doesn't seem the game adds excitement to fish retrieval).XP/currency - too much emphasis on points and currency rather than skills; microtransactions - a nice option, but seems to be designed as a cash grab.  Please - DO make money on this - development costs money.  But don't sacrifice fun and realism by making it pay-to-win.Fish AI - unrealistic expectations (i.e. 'use a 16 inch leader with a size 6 hook').  Following guidelines to increase the odds of catching a fish is good - but forcing players to stick to a formula and grind away is just not fun.Music - need more of it.Interface - a bit confusing; example: ESC key does different things or nothing at all; GUI needs to be consistent amongst the different screens.=== Pros ===Graphics - WOW - spot on!  They are truly amazing.  3D texturing, beautiful ambience, plenty of attention to detail with the tackle/baits/etc.Music - I've only heard a single track so far, but it's good.  That is the style that is fitting for a fishing simulation, and I'd love to hear more others like it!Fish species - It's nice to see no limitation imposed; carp, bass, catfish, sunfish, etc. - they all matter.Realism - FINALLY, no forced underwater view!  No annoying announcers.  No arcade elements.  A simulation :-)Tutorials - A nice touch.Support / dev feedback / wiki - Some of the best I've seen anywhere.  Listening to your user base and keeping them 'in the loop' will help keep this game thriving for years to come.

								Totally awesome game.  People say it is relaxing, and it is to start.  At some point it is fun to fish tournments, adds stress but fun.  There are also leader boards, that reset every 7 dsys, fun to attempt to get your name listed, adds stress.  Not bad  stress just the stress of competition.  Some people think it is tough at that start, and it is.  However, this is what makes it so fun and different.  We get so used to go here do this.  You all what  I am talking about; pick up a quest, wiki the quest and it says go here do this complete the quest.  The days of having to figure out how to complete a quest are gone.  WoW has an arrow pointing the direction you need to go, where's the fun in that?  This is a fishing game, and like fishing, you never know what lies beneith the waves.

								After playing about three hours of this game, I can say that this game is pretty good for a simulator. i get a sense of satisfaction everytime i catch a fish, maybe it's the feeling of progress I don't know. it's something someone who knows nothing about fishing can pick up and play, and have a good time. You don't have to spend money on this game, it gives you premium currency everytime you level. But if you want to spend money, than you can get access to stuff faster. Personally i think you shouldn't spend money on this game, except to support the devs but if you spend money to get an edge. Why? there's next to no competition, so why spend money to level faster? Unless of course you have money to spend, in which case go wild!10 ata 10Would fish for catfish again

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL;DR- Fishing without early mornings and outdoors.  Honestly it is way warmer inside and comfier in your desk chair.- Fishing where you actually catch something.Linked video where I run through the basics of the game:  


YouTube™ Video: Fishing Planet PC Early Access Review 

			Views: 37		

			I'm back and this week I review an Early Access Free-to-Play Game. Fishing Planet. This is essentially a fishing simulator that is showing a lot of promise.		

The long review: This is essentially a fishing simulator that is showing a lot of promise.  The possible expansions they have planned is intriguing but the basics make you feel like you are out there fishing.Game play it is very basic, cast, wait for a bite, reel the fish in.  There are casting rods if you prefer that to sitting watching a float.  The bigger the fish typically the better the experience which helps unlock the better equipment.Micro-transactions are not rammed down your throat and they are using a model of premium time or buying currency much like World of Tanks.  Also similar to World of Tanks the better bait is premium currency.If the devs round out even what they say is coming this will provide many hours of entertainment.  Other locations would be awesome too, along with deep sea fishing?  Plus it is free-to-play without buy this everywhere.

YouTube™ Video: Fishing Planet PC Early Access Review 

			Views: 37		

			I'm back and this week I review an Early Access Free-to-Play Game. Fishing Planet. This is essentially a fishing simulator that is showing a lot of promise.		

The long review: This is essentially a fishing simulator that is showing a lot of promise.  The possible expansions they have planned is intriguing but the basics make you feel like you are out there fishing.Game play it is very basic, cast, wait for a bite, reel the fish in.  There are casting rods if you prefer that to sitting watching a float.  The bigger the fish typically the better the experience which helps unlock the better equipment.Micro-transactions are not rammed down your throat and they are using a model of premium time or buying currency much like World of Tanks.  Also similar to World of Tanks the better bait is premium currency.If the devs round out even what they say is coming this will provide many hours of entertainment.  Other locations would be awesome too, along with deep sea fishing?  Plus it is free-to-play without buy this everywhere.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								after playing 7 hours straight and catching this most recent fish i decided that a review for this game would best be put in a story of the monster catch i made.                                                                 ----------------------------------------------- It was a dark, stormy afternoon. I had set out that morning with the few fishing accessories i could scrounge up after only 5 hours of fishing experience. Although all I had was a float caster, 3lb test and small cutbait to my name, I was soon to have a legacy. I went out in search of the biggest thing in my hometown lake, the aligator gar. I felt him nibbling at my hook, and it was all I could do to wait for the time when he was most vulnerable...BAM. he was on, and i was ready. he took me to the end of me line and held me there for what seemed like centuries. after he was done torturing me at that distance he was running low on power. I brought all the strength I had left to the end of my pole and pulled relentlessly against him. I tell you it was half past 2 by the time I got em this far. slowly i pulled him in, one foot at a time until he decided to get up and runoff again! I was disheartened by the affair but continued to pull him in. me friends all told me that it was an impossible task, break me line. oh no...not me. Ill never be conqured by a wee fish! now the time was 3:15 when i finally got him to 10 feet, and i had not a single foot o' pullin left in me so I ran into the water and jumped on him. I saw the beast in all his glory as i pulled him out of the water. my friends were amazed, never to speak an off word to me again. I became a legend that night, I became immortal.                                                                        ---------------------------over the course of hauling in the fish, it was the coolest experience ive had with a ftp game. the community is nice and helpful, the game is relaxing and overall its something worth wasting a lot of time on. The physics need work still since i was able to catch a 30 lb gar on 3lb test, but other than that Im very pleased with what ive seen so far and think its really worth playing.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Originally, I was going to put a funny review like "♥♥♥♥ catfish" or "more like Bluegill Planet LOL", but I guess I might as well make something serious once a while, right?The game has a memory leak thing going on, make sure to turn of anti-aliasing or else you might experience severe FPS drops (I'm talking like dropping down to 5 FPS) after about 1 hour of play.The game is incredibly slow at first because until you hit level 3, all you can do is cast bait and wait for something to bite. And without actually knowing anything about fishing, that's going to be Bluegills. Or Pumpkinseed. Very rarely. So what do you do? You... actually figure out how to fish. Either do that by asking people in the chat (because we all love answering 10 times a day how to catch a bass or catfish), or by reading the absolutely marvelous Steam guides. You could also actually read up on how to catch this thing IRL, because this simulator is incredibly realistic in the sense that they implemented real-life fishing tactics to work ingame. That's pretty sick.Once you hit 3, you probably want to grab yourself a Spinning Rod and, well, spin. That's a much needed change of pace I found, since instead of waiting for something you bite you reel in the lure... and then you wait for something to bite. I don't know what people expect, this is a fishing simulator. Pretty much all you do is wait for something to bite. It's incredibly engaging if you like exploring areas, figuring out cool fishing spots, and eventually collecting all the different sorts of fish that are in the game. I would like to mention, I've played for like 30 hours now and I haven't even seen half of what the game has to offer. That is, of course, in part because of the relatively slow leveling system, but also because the game actually has a substantial amount of content for something so recently released. For a free to play Early Access game, it's actually amazing of how much content this game has compared to some other games on Steam.It should be mentioned that ANYTHING in the game can be obtained with ingame money. You do not need to spend a single cent on this game. Sure, yes, of course, it speeds things up, but not even by a significant amount. Fishing isn't "easier" by buying things. In fact, reeling in a big fish is completely skill-based, and even if you spent a hundred bucks it won't be any easier. That's because the most powerful equipment in the game is purchased by achievement coins. And, as you guessed, you get those coins by doing achievements or logging in 5 days in a row. You can only buy regular money with real money, and that's stuff you usually get plenty of ingame. Personally, the only really overpriced thing in the game in my opinion are licenses for new areas. And that's only because I want to save up for permanent licenses. Licenses to catch certain fish are cheap for a day, and probably worth investing in if you play the game often, I just really hate buying timed stuff because I feel forced to play something instead of doing it on my own.All in all, this is an incredibly solid fishing experience, it's addicting if you like collecting stuff and not a whole lot of fun unless you like fishing. But give it a try, it's free. Maybe you're like me, and you didn't even know you have a passion for fishing.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: Let's Play Fishing Planet EP1 Emerald Lake 

			Views: 7,324		

			Let's catch some damn fish! Get this game for FREE on steam here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/380600/		

I feel this FTP Fishing Simulator has alot going for it, but most of all I think it's fun to play and the microtransactions don't interfere with my enjoyment of the game. As I understand it everything in the game you can unlock without spending real money which I like. The only thing you really need to invest is time at this point. As far as Fishing Simulators go there isn't much to choose from but I feel this is one of the best. You can buy gear from a very imaginative "online store front" type menu which I got a big kick out of. It's easy to load an area get your rod out and fish. You have to experiment to learn all the different fishes habits, where they like to go, what they eat, what depth to fish at, weather, and time of day. The descriptions of the various baits, rods, lines, and hooks give you clues as to what fish they will catch.Now the bad, there's a risk of running out of money farely early if you make some bad trips or don't bring the correct bait/rod, OR forget to buy the correct liscence. If you don't have the correct liscence for your target species and you catch a trophie you're forced to throw it back or face a hefty fine. You also need to make sure your stringer or keep net has the capacity to hold a large fish. If you run out of cash you have to either buy more with real money or stop playing and wait till the next real life day where the game gives you some in game cash. It's not a big deal if you know what you're doing and don't make some bad purchases, I however didn't realize this.Overall I'm enjoying the game, the visuals are good and I hope they add more content as time goes on. A 2 player coop where you can actually fish next to your friends on a trip would be great.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now you too can tell "the one that got away" stories at the water cooler on Monday!  The adrenaline rush of landing a trophy fish comes without the fish smell, although sometimes you would swear it is all real...especially the mosquitoes.  I love the scope of the game, from great bass action, to the big lunkers of the northern lakes, to the fun of fighting rainbow trout in Colorado.  Some parts of the game are unrealistic (Atlantic Salmon in Lake Louise - aka White Moose Lake), but all parts are pure unadulterated fun!  DLC adds even more, and a way to get better equipment sooner.  This game is well supported by the community with lots of guides available and plenty of players willing to share advice to get you started.  Join the fun and that 25lb Lake Trout could be mounted above your fireplace by tonight!

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								after playing 7 hours straight and catching this most recent fish i decided that a review for this game would best be put in a story of the monster catch i made.                                                                 ----------------------------------------------- It was a dark, stormy afternoon. I had set out that morning with the few fishing accessories i could scrounge up after only 5 hours of fishing experience. Although all I had was a float caster, 3lb test and small cutbait to my name, I was soon to have a legacy. I went out in search of the biggest thing in my hometown lake, the aligator gar. I felt him nibbling at my hook, and it was all I could do to wait for the time when he was most vulnerable...BAM. he was on, and i was ready. he took me to the end of me line and held me there for what seemed like centuries. after he was done torturing me at that distance he was running low on power. I brought all the strength I had left to the end of my pole and pulled relentlessly against him. I tell you it was half past 2 by the time I got em this far. slowly i pulled him in, one foot at a time until he decided to get up and runoff again! I was disheartened by the affair but continued to pull him in. me friends all told me that it was an impossible task, break me line. oh no...not me. Ill never be conqured by a wee fish! now the time was 3:15 when i finally got him to 10 feet, and i had not a single foot o' pullin left in me so I ran into the water and jumped on him. I saw the beast in all his glory as i pulled him out of the water. my friends were amazed, never to speak an off word to me again. I became a legend that night, I became immortal.                                                                        ---------------------------over the course of hauling in the fish, it was the coolest experience ive had with a ftp game. the community is nice and helpful, the game is relaxing and overall its something worth wasting a lot of time on. The physics need work still since i was able to catch a 30 lb gar on 3lb test, but other than that Im very pleased with what ive seen so far and think its really worth playing.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of all, the game is very promising, not just there yet, but has potential of being the best Fishing Simulator so far. But let's check the pros and consPros:- Not just a game, a super realistic simulation- Fully customizable equipment from rods&reels to your hat&boots- Many ways to fish, many places to fish- Again, realistic gameplay forces LICENSES (awesome!)- Good visuals- A really helpful communityCons:- Good graphics brings lag from time to time (though I tried the game after a Starcraft II marathon that lasted over 40 hours, so gotta check it out later.)- F1 Controls Panel is too messy that I closed it right away and asked the community for most of controls- Tutorial? Is there any? I mean "Throw the bait using LMB *LMB image*" Thanks mate! Reallly helpful it was. I was about stick rod right up to my a**.-Uhm... I thought this was Multiplayer? I thought it was, Co-Operative? No? Oh... Seriously only thing that looks Multi-Player is the chat-box. Th game promises to have some tournaments but... C'mon WE WANNA THROW THE THINGY TOGETHER!!!Overall, this game is good, looks good, will be even better! 'cuz the game is already good, you can see it in the "pros" section up there and it's "cons" stated above are al fixable cons. Highly, seriously recommended. I don't know how to wait for my computer to relax a bit to play this game under better circumstances. Add me, message me and blah blah blah-di blah.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game is amazing! The realism and customization are second to none. I've been a fisherman all my life, but due to my health, I'm not able to get out like I used to. Fishing Planet has helped to relieve those urges. The community is great. There is always going to be an occasional troll, but this isn't a WoW crowd. People on here love to fish and to talk about it. I am almost level 13 after 69 hours of game time and haven't had to spend a single dollar of my money; however, because the devs are doing such a wonderful job, I bought a couple of DLC packs just to support them. More items are coming in addition to game features, but the game is very playable now.Try it out. You only have time to lose.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now you too can tell "the one that got away" stories at the water cooler on Monday!  The adrenaline rush of landing a trophy fish comes without the fish smell, although sometimes you would swear it is all real...especially the mosquitoes.  I love the scope of the game, from great bass action, to the big lunkers of the northern lakes, to the fun of fighting rainbow trout in Colorado.  Some parts of the game are unrealistic (Atlantic Salmon in Lake Louise - aka White Moose Lake), but all parts are pure unadulterated fun!  DLC adds even more, and a way to get better equipment sooner.  This game is well supported by the community with lots of guides available and plenty of players willing to share advice to get you started.  Join the fun and that 25lb Lake Trout could be mounted above your fireplace by tonight!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a fun fishing game. No really! It is! It has locations and species that I love to fish. The atmosphere is relaxing and I love fretting about what lure and rig to use to catch what I'm after. I've found that techniques I use IRL seem to work in game too, though some take a little tweaking in game to get right. One aspect I was not looking forward to was the social aspect. It turns out that seeing what others are catching and being able to chat about technique and setups has been a fun experience!This is a darned good fishing game and it's free! In fact, I'd be hard pressed to find one that I enjoy more. Now, if they add some more little goodies like fly fishing streams and more complex lure rigs...The support for this game is pretty snappy too! I ran into a snag with my account and wrote to support. Olga, the awesome support agent, helped me out and go me through the sticky mess. Thank you Olga for helping me out!The Good:  Support  Atmosphere  Fish selection  Tackle selection  Hillbilly music  Seasonal events with a sasquatch fish, aka furry trout. The Bad (ish)  Some rather bizzare physics for the fishing lines at times  Minor clipping errors  No way to suggest features / report bugs in game (it's in alpha)  The furry trout, while fun for an event I worry that the game could become cluttered with make-believe fish

YouTube™ Video: Fishing Planet♥♥♥♥♥♥ft. Glorious Helicopter Fish

Editor's note: I didn't uninstall the game I like it too muchAlso the bass fishing is really interactive and fun. Explains through flashing rod stress meters what you have to do, they will break your line and you need to ♥♥♥♥ with the drag on your reel to get your fish; feels like a true challenge everytime you land a nice fish. 10/10 best game, best game, 9/10, 5 stars, 4 stars, 5 stars.The float fishing is realistic, reminds me of dangling bread off the bridge in my local park and catching carp with a handreel.Levelling up takes time and is nicely balanced.The graphics are astounding, the game looks better than Unreal Engine 3 and it's made in bloody Unity.
