Early access probably means some bugs will happen and stuff, but it should be okay as long as it doesn't stay in Early Access forever.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								I could write a review full of dank memes and badly written puns... but I won't.Fishing Planet is a fishing simulator that puts you in the boots of a pro fisher wannabe.  You must manage your gear, bait, and areas in which you fish.  In all honestly, it's a step above your average simulator game.  I say this because as I was sitting here, waiting for the next bluegill to bite, I heard the virtual drone of a badly rendered fly.  Instinctively, I swatted my right ear to get rid of it.  Yeah, that didn't work.  Somehow, a game not worth more than a couple minutes worth of play time, 'fer da luls', managed to fully drag me into itself.  It might have been because I haven't slept in several days or that I have finals that I should be studying for.  Nevertheless, as Fishing Planet is free to play, I recommend that you try it out for a few minutes and see if you find the same nirvana I slipped into while playing.  Let the calming music soothe you, the gentle rustle of the wind relax you, and the almost inaudible *BLIPP* as the lure sinks into the water comfort you, until your mind turns to rage at the consistant "Fish tried to bite and escaped".

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								While grindy, I think this game is a lot of fun. Leveling can can stale and repetitive and money management can be a little bit of an issue, but I think it works well enough for the pacing of the game. I mean it's fishing, you could fill up your fish keeper in half an hour or it could take you 2 hours. To be smart about things you'd have to do a little research, whether it be reading some guides or watching some youtube videos cause venturing past the first two maps could be a little pricey. However if you manage your trip right you could make a lot of money and get a lot of xp.I do feel that this game could use a better tutorial explaining all of the mechanics. The rods and reels could have "stats" like speed and stuff that are at least easier explained for people who arent very fishing savvy. This would help in building a set up that works how you want to without regretting it later.All in all I would give this game a solid 8/10 cause it's fun and scratches the itch to want to fish but it could use a little more work.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm an avid angler in RL and the chance to play this free "after hours" was a welcome relief from being locked down by windy days, work and life in general. The scenery, while not spectacular, is very nice and the ambience is just so soothing. Rod & Reel action is nicely mimic'd although there are glitches with bouncing rods etc. but you were certainly able to "feel" a fish without actually having a tactile sense of it.The fishing predictability is not good though. Rumour has it that devs want to do more here but when you can literally read the chat and copy what everbody else is doing, and it's consistent. Ahhh. It's just not fishing at all.Case in point. Catfish. Cast 10m out towards the green kayak. Set your small cut bait 2m down and you are as good as guaranteed a quality catfish. I fished after 19:00 everytime and was pulling trophy catfish (in excess of 3kg) almost one after the other. Want trout? 7g rainbow spinner, cast to 4th tree while standing on square rock and use a Stop & Go retrieve. 16:00 - 18:00 hours is what they all say. Sure enough. Trout.The fishing became very, very predictable. Even worse, variations inevitably produced very little so you end up just reverting to same ol' same ol' just to keep the catch rate up... and you need the catch rate because devs wrapped what you catch to a levelling system. imho, the devs made a mistake here, ie: making areas and species accessible only through skilling up. This is done purely by grinding through scores of fish. You can't buy past it (deliberate pun there folks), you can't cicumvent. You just have to do it.  Equipment and more "advanced" baits etc. are also wrapped around the same modelling. It soon became obvious that to be able to fish for the more legendary species in the more exotic locations with the better rigs, baits and lures you would need hours (and hours) of doing the same thing over and over. This just doesn't happen in RL and it annoys me. When a game claims to be a "simulator" it needs to simulate, not inhibit gameplay with some trite levelling more akin to an RPG. The reasoning behind such a system completely escapes me. It's almost like the devs want you to play the entire game sequentially to make sure you admire everything they've done.The best bit though (no, it is), the game is absolutely F2P but... it's really grindy to do so. You can take a credit card swipe for some faster skill point bonuses and "advanced" fish licences but it just seems to be so little value for money. If RM gave access to better areas and equipment ( not tied to comps/tourneys obviously ) rather than "purchasing" XP boost so you can get to better areas faster, it would certainly entice me to open the coin purse a little more readily.All in all, a good relaxing game despite the predicability, and given you can progress through the entire game and never spend a cent, can't complain too much. If you like fishing, grab it now. Being free makes any Early Access argument about completion/development rate V purchase risk completely moot.7/10Go fishin'

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								For a fishing game, and me being a fisheran, I have found this game to be very true in so many respects, while there are some minor problems with how the ine acts, and reacts to the water, and the casting mechanics can sometimes be wonky, HOWEVER, the fish all respond the proper way, they hit the baits the same way real fish do, and their fights are much the same as in real life as ye can get without actually feeling the rod bend in your hands and the thrill of the first solid hook. The only other problem is that it will run your video card on the hot side due to the fact that they rendered the entire space and the trees on the far side of the water area, as wel as the water surface and reflections, so that graphics card can get a real workout, but it is VERY Much Worth it if you are a real fisherman.  So far I have managed to take the time and slowly, oh so slowly, bring in a 17+lb Flathead Catfish on 8 lb test.  Just a matter of playing him out, letting him run under light but constant, wearing tension, the tension keeps it moving to escape, which will, eventually, hopefully, tire it out so that you can then slowly bring it in to you.  So, I would Heartily Reccomend this game to any and all folks wo either fish or would like to learn how.Say "HI" to Cutch fer me, I visited him long ago and got my copy of DeerHunter 2K5 from him, such a good fellow, knew some of the folks my grandparents did, similar hunting and fishing areas, and he was an excellent games tester as for the reality end.!Chuck Sweet as Steelwolf

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Reason for down vote:1. 75$ of DLC when the game is not even finished yet. This is the main reason why I am no longer buying Total War series. DLC should be mini-expansion packs, not extra cash grab to unlock whats part of the base game. Having DLC on release day is a slap in the wallet. 75$ is more than what a brand name game costs, what would justify paying that for this? While this particular base game is free, it is only for the moment.2. Want to catch trophy fish? Well, go to the right spot, get the one lure that allows you to catch it, and cast. That's it. No variation, no trick of the trade, nothing. Grind to the right lure, grind for in game money, travel to the next location. Repeat.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								This in an awesome game if you enjoy fishing. Very realistic feel to the game. You don't find catfish roaming the surface for flies, pan fish aren't hiding at the bottom. Generally the fish are where they would be in real life. The different tecniques used help you fish more like yourself rather than simply casting and reeling. (twitch, stop & go, lift and drop)The leveling and trophy systems are great for those who still want something to work towards.The biggest thing about this game is patience... If you are going to play and ONLY worry about levels and trying to go fast... don't bother, It's not Call of Duty, you're not meant to level as high as you can in one day, you're not going to catch the biggest fish in the game right away. People in game tend to be pretty friendly, you do get the odd person who just wants attention and blurts out profanity, but for the most part people are willing to help you succeed at what you're doing. Hope this helps some people out.... ohh... and as of the time I'm writting this... it's free..... just get it.... lol

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								I had to stop fishing Trophy Rainbow Trout out in colarado just to write this review! First of all I am not an avid fisherman in real life, I have gone fishing a few times as a kid as most people have, however I never really had the ability or drive to make it a real hobby. With that being said, I was still able to really enjoy this game, and am continuing to enjoy  it so far. Now it should be noted that this game is very realistic, every fish has its own specific set of baits, water depths, and areas/ times of day they like. So if you have fished before, or know a bit about fishing it makes this game a bit easier. However even if you really don't know too much about fishing, a lot of the fun i personally had with this game, was researching what different fish liked, and trying to find my own areas and baits that worked for me. Fish fights have been improved since the inital launch of this game, you can really feel the difference between a normal fish, and a trophy fish. Sometimes forcing you into a fish fight between 60 seconds, to a few minutes! It's really an exciting feeling when you first catch that big catch.  It should be noted that for the first hour of playing will be spent catching 0.5lb Blue Gills, and such. This is too introduce you to bobber fishing, once you are level 3, you should go buy a spoon, and try casting in the reeds for some bass, or throw some petfood on your bobber, and set the line to max and try to catch some catfish. YOU SHOULD TRY THIS GAME.(RESERVED) I Intend to review some of the interfaces and high level play at a later date.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I am hooked! I would be okay paying for this game, but they let you have it for free! There are some things I would like to see added but It still early access. I've experienced remarkably smooth gameplay.  Havn't found a bug yet. I did have to turn down the rendering settings a notch because my CPU started to overheat.  The game mechanics are awesome. There is no stupid underwater mini game you play to catch the fish like you see in other fishing games. This uses rod+reel+line+drag+patience=fish on! Choose your gear and fill your tacklebox before heading out to the water. Seems like most items can be unlocked and purchased within the game using the money you earn while fishing, I kind of like having to work up the ladder so to speak, Wondering if they'll ever introduce boats and sonar. Rod holders + bite buzzers? Polarized sunglasses? If you like to fish, you will love this game. If you want to learn how to fish for real, this game shows you all the basics to get started. If you hate fishing and simulators, this mnight not be for you.

								This game really took me by surprise! I am typically more into FPS, Fighting and MMORPG's - I gave this game a try because it was free, and boy was it a decision that I am happy I made. The graphics are nice, the environment and ambient sounds are a masterpiece as well... the game, within a few minutes can take you away from the daily grind and helps you feel relaxed. The only drawback is, I can't really cook the fish. Aside from that, downloading, installing and playing this game is highly recommended. content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								     This game is what an early access game on Steam should be. Note, it isn't perfect it does occasionally crash and lag out. Majority of that has been fixed in the last 4 days. Also, those negative reviews are BS, they are people who hate the idea of even a modicum of micro transactions in a game and have computers made in 2002 so they can't run it well enough either. Yes the first hour or so is slow, all you catch is Bluegill and Crappie, but read reviews, do research and you learn that by lvl 4 or 5 you can bass fish. This makes the leveling up process much faster and much more enjoyable.     The micro transactions are limited to spend lots of money to be able to have gear in order to catch certain fish, or spend money to get a 50%XP increase per fish (not a big deal)and finally, get some ingame dollars. You cannot buy gold coins, they only come from unique fish (which  you need to work extremely hard for).     The gameplay is amazing, it's got realistic physics on spin fishing and even cast fishing. They occasional bug happens but this is an early access game for christs sake come on. Yeah, the drag systems aren't neccesarily realistic, but it's easy enough to understand, you shouldn't have issues not breaking stuff.     Most importantly this game gives you stockholm syndrome. It's that abusive boyfriend or girlfriend you have that you can't help but love. It is hard, and♥♥♥♥♥♥happens, but when things go right, it feels absolutely amazing. It's all forgiven for that one 5.2 LBS trophy largemouth bass that you worked so hard for.rating 10/10 addictive and a great simulator

Early Access Review
								I love this game I must say, having never fished in real life but wanting to this is great fun, I liked the challenge of getting past the lower lvl' sand away from catching the dreaded bluegill, but once in game I have found people really helpful if steering you in the right direction for bass and cats. I do think that sorting the friends and chat should be top of the list, it sucks being in a good chat group just for then day to end, jump back in and your with a whole new group. All in all for a game in beta this is fantastic, with the right choices this game could be amazing once fully released. Would love to hear from a dev about what they have in mind for the club aspect, this could be a huge selling point having club competitions and so in.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've never fished irl but I'm strangely addicted to this game.  When starting out, please refer to guides and tutorials. Those as always, help you familiarise with the mechanics. Leveling is easy when you target specific fishes that generally give more exp or money. You need to pay attention to the details of your gear to land anything more than the basic bluegill and not break your line. Also the weather and time chart affect's the strike rate. Paid dlcs for the most part, give you gear that you would otherwise not be able to get at your level. However, it is optional as you can get your gear without paying a dime.  One of things I don't like is that you can fish with other people but you can't phyiscally see them in game. You only see them in chat.  I'd say give this a try if youre interested in fishing. It's free anyways.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 20
Early Access Review
								Ok, so I haven't had this game that long but I have played it enough to give a good review. Now lets start off like this:This game is a really good representation of really fishing. you don't catch fish every cast and when you do catch fish, it isn't a giant (1-2 pounder bass wise). The mechanics are really good and i mean this game runs smooth on a laptop not designed for gaming so thats a big pro. Ok now... the cons (subjective maybe) Ok so the way you have get snagged. its annoying but it isnt killing the game. I love fishing lillie pads but almost everytime I get snagged. again maybe subjective. another con has to be where you can fish on a lake. I feel that it is just way to limited. I know you can cast to places you can't wallk but what if you want to cast that way but at a different angle? I feel that instead of putting markers down there should be one at the louge or whatever and then you can walk whereever you please around the pond/lake (river is different maybe section the it off would be good.  I think it just gets to crowded sometimes. remember you got this game realistic   how about add to that by adding this to it.     ummm other than that I think this game is really good. great job devs! now.. do I recommend this game. yes absolutly but ONLY if you don't care for long waits before you get a fish or the fish you want.

								What is FISHING PLANET?It's the ultimate sportfishing simulator! Making the weekend of your choice available to you anytime, anywhere. Take a break from exhausting everyday reality! Transform your day into a real holiday with stunning photo-realistic graphics and lifelike fish behavior as well as detailed angling techniques. content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								After 1671 hours of play I've decided that a reveiw is in order! This Game is a "simulation" type of game. It is intended for those that wish to learn about fishing in real life while still having an enjoyable experience playing a game from what I can tell. It has a steep learning curve for beginners. It is advised that alll new players use the tutorials and Youtube video's to help them advance to the higher levels. As it stands now, the more durable gear is accesible thru purchase outright,or purchase ingame with ingame currency after reaching certain levels.I find the game to be enjoyable,and relaxing. After a hard day of work,the sounds of the great outdoors,and companionship of the social aspects of the game are fantastic.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								Good game, particularly so for a fishing game, and free to play no less. Most fishing games dissapoint me pretty badly and so I hadn't actually played one for a while. I decided to give Fishing Planet a chance and found it to be a pretty cool game. Yes it can be a bit slow, and it can seem almost impossible to catch fish at times but it seems like every time I had issues the community was able to help me out. It's pretty common for the people online to be helpful and pretty friendly in my experience. All around this game is pretty fun, and although I haven't played much in the last few weeks and the dynamic can always change, it seems like it tends to draw a pretty decent crowd of players. If you enjoy fishing enough to enjoy fishing games, or otherwise like fishing games I would recommend giving this game a shot.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								A very good ‘free to play’ experience for a casual dip. Though ultimately a game which loses itself between visions of a great Fishing Simulation and just a Fishing Game.Akin to a Hollywood movie, which having employed a quality writer, director and cast, is sabotaged by producers and editors imposing a 'lollypop' formula upon it. Having lost sight of the fact that fishing is the most popular sport on the planet, the producers decided to change direction mid project. Distancing themselves from an audience seeking a long term relationship they opened the door on a casual fling. This compromise will leave both the non fisher and fisher feeling unfulfilled. Great promise replaced by short term gratification.‘Lollypops’, in the form of paid DLC, throw balance out the window. They provide a short term ‘hit’ for those not seeking a simulation, though hardly encourage any hopes of longevity for the project.To continue the Hollywood theme. Here we have a movie which will benefit from a ‘Directors Cut’ sometime in the future.Meanwhile, enjoy the initial free to play part and don’t grieve too much over the producers missed opportunity.  Their loss, my disappointment. GM

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								How many of my 275 hours have i sat casting into water with 0 chance a fish will spawn because i am 2 feet outside the spawn box when IRL you would expect fish there.I loved this game until i started to find out more about how it works and now i am not enjoying it anymore :( i wish i could go back in time.Ignorance is BlissRecently from various Steam community discussions i found out more about how the game works specifically fish spawning in boxes i do not understand it well but if gives me the impression that fish spawn when you cast in box 1, 2, 3, 4 etc around the lake and outside the box’s no fish will spawn.I always knew the fish where in locations from chat and guides but for a long time i actually thought there where fish there then i saw chat mentioning fish spawning when you cast and that there where not fish in the water i was a bit disappointed but ok with this at first thinking there must be some complicated system and well it probably is quite complicated but now reading about spawn boxes and it seams you are in or out of them chance at a fish or no chance and also seeing a image or 2 posted it just makes me think i am completely wasting my time with a bunch of my casts not hitting spawn boxes and it is so not like real life we might as well be standing in a field casting at a fishing tank if we miss nothing if we get in the tank a chance at a fish. I want to know i have a small chance at a fish every cast anywhere, if the lakes are completely covered  in spawn boxes, zones or whatever with different % chance on a fish spawning wherever i cast in the lake i would be happy enough to continue playing this game but from what i can tell at the moment that is not the way things are and it completely puts me off the game.I also do not understand whey we can’t have fish in the lakes swimming around its not like we have a huge distance we can cast so load distance for the fish from the player or we could even have them load in each time a cast is made using distance from the lure/float as the spawn distance. playing other games there are so many things spawned in and out as you move around loads going on at a huge distance why on earth could we not have even as little as 10 fish spawn in X feet around the lure each cast each fish with a large area of interest around it if it makes contact with the lure a random number roll or whatever decides if the fish will go after it or if we can manage 100 or more fish spawn in each time the area of interest for each fish could be a lot smaller. i have only ever made simple flash games so i have no real idea what i am talking about other than what i have seen in other games but i do not see a lot going on in FP compared to almost any other game i have played the last few years, can we only handle a not very interactive environment simple sky along with the player and 1 fish at a time could be i am just completely lacking in understanding.The FP team need to learn from other games how you do an event catching 4th of July Historic fish was not a fun thing to do. They gave us new Historic versions of fish we knew well and made them spawn in different locations and god knows what other things the changed about them, i only managed 2 and spent what i think is a lot of time for an event on a 3rd then after reading the problems other people where having along with the fact some seamed to be uncatchable i gave up on it and decided to give up on the game.Opening up the high level lakes to all players so they could get the flags seamed confuse people thinking it was so they could fish for historic fish so they got fines.They could of made this a fun holiday event if they made all the historic fish catchable with an average of say 1 hour spent per fish and they could of separated the event given high level players the chance to show off going after say just the biggest historic Muskie get there name on a special leader bored that would last until the next time the event came around.If they gave a duplicate version of one of the high level rod/reel/line setups that was not reparable to all players they could of then opened up all the lakes other than Michigan for 3 days even giving free travel for all players for 3 days so everyone could do the historic fish event with a total time say 5-8 hours over 3 day to get them all make it a fun event so many can get a hat and give a second hat for getting all the flag poles so even people who only have spare time to log on for a few hours the holiday weekend can get something out of it. Everyone would get to use the nice setup to get an XP boost over the 3 days and continue using it until the durability ran out or they could just remove it after the event and low level players could experience some of what they have to look forward to encouraging them to grind up the levels. Make it so expensive it takes many hours farming credits per trip so even the hard core players need to spend a chunk of hours to visit two or 3 times a week real time so people will have to get credits on the store for Real money if they want spend more time there getting on leaderboards, having fun or farming XP.If you want to make money off low level players let them unlock higher level lakes with real money and they will also get dlc rods etc on the store to be able to fish there, you will always find people willing to pay for a boost.

content:
Posted: April 2
Early Access Review
								My positive recommendation is only based off this game being Free to get and play.  This game has been fun to play, though sometimes it feels more like real life fishing with the looooooooong delays between fish caught.  There are also a few bugs that get in the way of catching fish (like being told you've moved the bait too far away from the fish when you haven't moved it).Overall, I've enjoyed the game and I do reccomend giving it a FREE try.However,  I do not reccomend spending a single penny on this game as this time.  If you insist on spending money, do NOT reference the Fishing Planet's Wiki (you know, the first thing that pops up if you search for "Fishing Planet Premium" on Google).  It hasn't been updated since 2015 (which I think shows where the developers interests really are) and you will NOT get what it says you will get.Premium only gives 50% more experience and 50% more currency from fish sold.  That's it.  Period.  Pay the $99 (a full, deluxe version of a game these days) for a year of premium and that's still all you will get.So it appears that at a fundemental level they do not understand the relationship a gaming company must have with it's players to hold onto them and become profitable at the same time.  Without some changes this game will eventually die and that makes me a bit sad as I actually enjoy playing it.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you are an angler, or virtual fishing enthusiast, this game might be for you. I say "might", because unless you are willing to spend $50 or more, it is a serious grind to earn money and upgrade your gear. I have 3.1 hours, and am only level 3. I probably will play more at some future date, but I am unwilling to spend either a hundred hours or dollars to make this game enjoyable.  One of the early real money bottlenecks is traveling and day fees. If you don't catch catfish and white crappie all the time, you will run out of in-game currency fast.  This game, like all free to play, is geared toward real money. I wouldn't have a problem with most free to play games, if items and bundles weren't so expensive. I have spent over $100 on TheHunter, Mechwarrior online, etc. Unless free to plays downgrade their premium prices, I won't spend much time in them.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								A very good ‘free to play’ experience for a casual dip. Though ultimately a game which loses itself between visions of a great Fishing Simulation and just a Fishing Game.Akin to a Hollywood movie, which having employed a quality writer, director and cast, is sabotaged by producers and editors imposing a 'lollypop' formula upon it. Having lost sight of the fact that fishing is the most popular sport on the planet, the producers decided to change direction mid project. Distancing themselves from an audience seeking a long term relationship they opened the door on a casual fling. This compromise will leave both the non fisher and fisher feeling unfulfilled. Great promise replaced by short term gratification.‘Lollypops’, in the form of paid DLC, throw balance out the window. They provide a short term ‘hit’ for those not seeking a simulation, though hardly encourage any hopes of longevity for the project.To continue the Hollywood theme. Here we have a movie which will benefit from a ‘Directors Cut’ sometime in the future.Meanwhile, enjoy the initial free to play part and don’t grieve too much over the producers missed opportunity.  Their loss, my disappointment. GM

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								What is FISHING PLANET?It's the ultimate sportfishing simulator! Making the weekend of your choice available to you anytime, anywhere. Take a break from exhausting everyday reality! Transform your day into a real holiday with stunning photo-realistic graphics and lifelike fish behavior as well as detailed angling techniques. Become a member of an elite private Anglers Club to find new friends and fishing buddies!Fishing Planet will be available to everyone for free. All you need is an internet connection and a downloaded client. Our game is based on free-to-win principle, which means you can can fully enjoy the experience, get achievements and win tournaments by relying exclusively on your personal skills without spending a dime.

By all means, it is free to dowload so feel free to press "play" and judge for yourself.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Update Review 1" 23 May 2016Now, this game was never going to be a 500+ hr time investment game like Farming Simulator, ETS2 and ATS or IL2 CloD are for me and indeed, if you look at my hours, I'm barely 13 hrs played but nevertheless, I thoroughly recommend this game still. I'm very pleased I got into it.I have really enjoyed every minute of this even if  I have not explored a huge amount nor have I yet tested all the options of equipment or bait. This is all ahead for me and I am in no rush.This game is just a very relaxing time spend, it's easy enough until you get a big fish and then it'll blip your heart rate some until you get control. As you can get into it easily without spending any real money there's no risk.The developers have been very supportive of potential customers and provided a unlimited access lake where a number of fish can be caught.This all leads me to still recommend this game even if there is the dreaded "buy a licence" component. Frankly, I not done this yet anyway so that experience is for another update but I don't seem to feel nearly as much of a problem in this title's case compared other titles using the same model.Original Review:  15 April 2016This review is an initial reaction after 3 days. I will need to come back and edit this review after I've spent more time in here.I picked up this game in early April, just as 0.3.7 update (Texas) arrived.Having read about 5 reviews and seeing a 'mostly positive' rating on STEAM, I downloaded.Installation was easy during which I watched a few YouTube videos. By installation complete, I knew enough to get out and go fishing.  A few hand holds greet you as you first play and they're great. Within no time, I'd been fishing. I can easily stay out of the 'realistic discussions' as I'm no real life angler but I appreciate the degree to which this title has achieved certain aspects of the real world activity.Any simulator is a compromise but if it's not fun, then it's no good. I can certainly see myself spending a while here and there going fishing between my other simulator gameplay activities.So with 3 days under my belt, I've found the setup easy, got into fishing without problems, found it very relaxing and enjoyable and even experienced my first update which adds a huge attraction to the title.I expect I will go ahead and purchase some items from the shop as I develop my experiences.I tend to be wary of 'free to play' in a title but not against them or even spending some money on this as long as I can get value and the money I spend remains as purchased value. One area I am slightly concerned about is the purchased license validity time. If they are in terms of 'Game time', then I will be happy. If they are real time however.... I will be quite disappointed.I am totally happy I took the time to check this title out and immediately, I would encourage anyone wondering about it, to try it out. Here is a youtube video of my early on session.   


YouTube™ Video: Jack Wall -  Let's Play Fishing Planet - Episode 1 

			Views: 180		

			http://www.fishingplanet.com/ Fishing Planet is a FREE to play unique and highly realistic online first-person multiplayer fishing simulator developed for anglers to bring you the full thrill of...

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								THIS IS MY ORIGIONAL REVIEW, THE UPDATED ONE IS BELOWIts got real fishing elements, But. this is legit friken waiting simulator 2015and its really laggyy.....UPDATED REVIEWThis is Fishing Planet. A game about litterally fishing.Back in september of 2015 i wrote the review above. That was negative, that isnt changing and heres why.This game is well made. Back when i first played it, it was a waiting simulator, took atleast 2 min to catch a single fish. Now that is has been fixed, i can understand why alot of people like this game now. personally i think its pretty well made BUT, and only BUT, alot of the mechanics that would make this game fun don't exist. For 1, the "Lake Map" First map i had to litterally wait through a 10 second loading screen just to move 10 feet to a pier, why i couldnt just walk and actually SAVE loading and  playing time on this i do not know. But the game does have a nice realism thing going for it, so theirs that....So lets get on to some things i like about it. (Or pros and cons if you will)Pros.Fun little gameNice realism effectDiverse fishDecent mechanics when it comes to catching fish.After the patches the game is no longer laggy, but is still somewhat poorly optimized.No longer a waiting simulator.surprisingly no Micro Transactions (My video lies, sorry, still new at this)ConsLoading screen timers can be a tad bit long.Needs a loading screen to walk 7 feet.Kinda pricy when it comes to DLCReally pricy when it comes to premium shop.....if you run out of money your kinda screwed uneless you play every day or buy cash.Lack of stats when it comes to equipment (Personally not a con, but it would be nice to see some stats)This game is good, i just dont enjoy it, alot of mechanics that would personally make this feel 100% real are missing, and it kinda just feels like something that i wish would have been better oriented.NOW FOR SOMETHING NEWMechanics i wish existedA boat to travle the lake.Some more open world kinda bitsnot having to wait for a loading screen to walk 7 feet to a peir........................................a bigger map with alot more options to do.a way to actually catch your OWN bait instead of buying it.I'm not being bias, honest. But this game just didnt appeal to me all that much. i saw a guy with 206 hours. so im pretty sure it appealed to him. But i guess to ones his own.You can see my crappy review video below!

Early Access Review
								So with more then 100 Hours straight under my Belt here is a short but honest review form me:The game is pretty neat, the graphics are okay (its a fishing game after al no FPS game), Number of equipment fish and Locations is okay for earley acces. The game for sure has potential, but the dev seam "undecided" which way to go... why i say that, well they lateley nerfed the spawn of trophy and unique fish to lower the farming  for xp and make it more realistic, but on the other hand fish dont really fight, nor does it realley matter how good you are at giving attraction to your lure as long as you give some to it every time. The same goes for location, find a hole that works at the time and you got a farming spot...Motivation wise, its terrible, once hit lvl 14+ it gets grindy...VERY GRINDY, i played many games with hard Grinds (navyfield for instance) but here the grind isnt funny at all, find a hole to farm, farm it till next level...rince and repeat and if you unlocked a new loaction rince and repeat there...out right depressingIn Addition, the Dev's start to put Muck at you face every trime, you say there is something wrong with the game...there standart then is to say "there is nothing wrong, everything is fine, and its because YOU dont understand how the game works...and then go on and do basicalley...nothing!Second there steam from is moderated by a powerhungry mod, who serves as the Dev's interceptor but isnt able to handle the power given to him and acts like an Despote...so mediocer game plus an bad way to handle the community even in Eearly acces...Keep away from this game!

content:
Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								For a free to play game, this is very well made. I've played a handful of other fishing games and this one by far takes the cake. Honestly, if this game were $5-10, it'd still be worth the price. It's great for casually fishing and having a peaceful time with friends. The game has the perks of both a fishing simulator (fish behavior is very realistic and knowledge about real fishing can apply to the game) and a fishing video game (there are certain places where fish can randomly spawn if you want that kind of stuff).Pros Very easy to get into (no difficult mechanics, but there are "hidden" mechanics, discussed in cons section). Not as grindy as other fishing games (still there, but it's a fishing game, so of course it's slow :p). Very accurate, you can tell the devs know a lot about fishing and care for the game. Updated regularly. Relaxing music/sound effects. Multiplayer is optional and enjoyable. (There's no voice chat and you can even hide other player models if you want, very nice mechanic in a fishing game. Alternatively, you can see where other people are fishing if you want to look for a popular spot.) Tons of fish! Huge variety of rods, reels, tackle, nets, everything. Very in depth when it comes to customizing your gear and tackle. Wide variety of places to fish at all around the US and one location in Canada.  Fishes' (?) habits affected by weather, temperature, and time of day.  Appropriate bait and techniques also affected by the above.Cons Retrieval mechanics could be explained more (or at all). Some things such as rod properties, usefulness of baits, etc. are not explained, which can be a source of ire for new players. No boats, canoes, or kayaks yet, though the devs spoke about adding them eventually.Other There is a premium currency called Baitcoins (lol), but it is mostly for things like unlocking certain equiptment early. They are however the only way of buying unlimited advanced fishing passes (which allow you to keep any fish you catch, otherwise you have to throw back certain fish like trophy or unique variants). You can still buy limited (24 real hour, 3 real day, week, month, etc.) advanced fishing passes using regular currency that pay for themselves very quickly.  ***At the time of writing, there was a recent update that overhauled prices. This lead to unlimited advanced passes becoming ridiculously overpriced, but another recent patch has lowered them again. The fishing is a bit grindy sometimes, but that's because it's a fishing game. The fun is supposed to be in the relaxed natre of fishing. (My two cents ahead). You won't find a single fishing game out there where you can just hop in, grab top level equipment after a few days of playing casually, and catch a record holding fish. You need to earn it. There was an update recently that overhauled the game almost entirely. Due to that, most of the videos or guides you look for will be outdated. There are of course bugs in this game, but nothing game breaking that I've encountered.Overall, I highly recommend it if you want a fishing game, casual or not.

Early Access Review
								Suprisingly good game!I downloaded this on a lark, and was quickly hooked, no pun intended.  It captures the "feel" of fishing really well, and there is a ton of depth to the game given all the variables at play.   Leader depth, type of hook, type of bait, position, time of day, line type...it all adds up to give the game a really polished and satisfying feel when you finally nail down everything for a particular spot.Highly recommended for anyone that has even a passing interest in fishing.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great fun and experience for all!   Much like the hunter it takes time to catch your pre even with a fight, Fishing Planet brings this community together, with positive attitude in catching or loosing the fish help is always around the corner, with a dedicated Teamspeak3 server the community hasn't just grown for the sake of gaming but brought many members of the gaming community together, myself a newbie fisher gained great help and experience from other fishers in the community and wonderful tips from people vastly out of my reach in this world.  Recent Patch Review Fighting has become even more intense with this patch, but few glitches are still here i would be glad to send them in a letter form if it made any help but its only small things, with the latest patch fighting the fish has become a game itself and a challenge, i like this patch due to the designers adding more dynamics into the game rather than just for quality of looks.   Here are the results i rate the game. (Out of 10 for best and 1 for awful)  Graphics Quality - 10 With dynamic water, advanced shading on plants and features and barely a spike on a high run system, this game is great in quality and beautiful in its own way.   Game Dynamics - 8 The games dynamics including the fish are what is to be said as okay, is a little more than an "okay". Ai bubbles on the water, shifting clouds and also the large sounds of animals in the environment make it a great realistic experience for new player to feel what its like to fish from their computers.   Personal Settings 4 Whilst its great we can change our game for pure beauty, we should be allowed to switch off our birds, quality of scenery or even the FX quality we want, i rate this a 4 because of its lack of options and functions to support controllers and also the fact that users cant customise their game to suit there computer.

Early Access Review
								saw game shuffling through black friday deals so decided to play it since free-to-play. a few hours into it i was hooked (lawl) and decided to pay for the discounted DLC package they had going for black friday. a few hours after making the purchase the game under went server maintence and then starts crashing and freezing 15-20 min into starting up after amintence was done.when the game crashes it doesnt register the exp or money made from fish currently caught and the money you spend in game to visit other lakes isnt refunded. the in game clock on the lake still runs so even if you log back in later you lose time.looking at the game's discussion board this is an ongoing issue with the game with absolutely no insight from the developers aside from "check your firewalls"game 10 hours into it is now unplayable and after spending money on it i cant recommend the game*******update****after many more hours into this game i have new information1) since the beginning of 2017 and their recent patches they have no started impelementing really heavy paywalls to push their premium account option and ingame currency. will go on to describe in next2) you were able to set a lake as your "home state", reducing the travel expense of that lake greatly and reducing nearby states. those allowing you save money. they have removed that option. now its a set fee, you cant set a home state, and the travel epxense are outragous, now taking several days of fishing low level lakes just to make enough cash to venture to these new lakes, and thats not counting the hours you need to spend grinding now for gear3) cost of geat has gone up signifcantly. its now as much money for one crankabit lure as it is to travel to most of the lower level states. this now means you have to spends (real life, like an entire weekend) just to make money to buy new gear like lures, lines and so on4) the durability on items seems like it has been reduced, and the cost for repair increase. before these patches it didnt seem like i had to repair my stuff as often as i do now, and the cosr to repair said gear is almost insulting. my fish keeper, the item you need to store fish to cash in, is at 4k to repair at only 60% durability. 4k... thats the price to travel to most of the mid level lakes.5) you used to be able to purchase a lifetime liscense to lakes with the ingame currency you earn by catching fish, now its only buyable with the baitcoin currency, the currency you can only get by buying baitcoin bundles or ingame rewards (which is no way to farm baitcoins). some fo the lakes its almost as much as the travel expense for a one day liscense,6) constant bugs that screw you over, like being DC'd for server maintance and not being refunding travel expenses/liscense fees on lake. when you leave a lake, you cant return without paying travel fees, a dc counts 9atleast for me) as leaving. another incident i will describe in an event i just had happened.7) they removed alligator gar from a low level lake area, giving some poeple a choice to limited out their fish keepers at a low cost, and added them to a new lake thats now the most expensive lake in the game.log in today, buy bait, head to new york lake to farm walleyes because of all the price increases. get to lake, find out the bait i bought wasnt added to bait i already had in my inventory, but was put in my home storage. all lakes have select tackle you can buy at location, other than that you have to leave and then pay said epxenses to return, try buying new bait there, wont stack and tackle box is full. have to leave. i get a repair window for items when leaving, and i didnt even fish! it was asking to repair a rod and reel, even though i didnt make a single cast, and not to mention, the 4000 repair bill on my fish stringer!go back to home storage and move the bait into my tackle box, go back to new york, paying the travel expense once again. get to the lake, catch my first fish, just to find out the game uniquiped my fish stringer (at only 60 total durability), thus i cant keep anyfish and amke any money, so i have to leave once again, now 3200 lost in cash. go back to home storage, and yep, there it is. no notification was given that the game removed in from my inventory. re-equip said items, no prompt saying it was too damaged to use, go to the newbie lake, cause now i have no money to go back to new york. it will take me half a saturday to make back most of the money i lost, and make no advancement to traveling to a lake i actually want to fish at.the paywalls are beyond ridcoulous. and this is a game i found fun enough to pay for dlc to support this game, and every patch released this new year has screwed its players base aside from adding a new lake.

I ATE MY KEYBOARD TRYING TO TASTE ONE!Verdict: Do you like fishing?  Want to fish with friends?Go fish with friends IRL, this game is just minecraft fishing mechanics with improved graphics

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here is the best way I can explain this game. It is an Alpha fishing simulator that is pulling in people not only from the gaming community, but the fishing community too. It's the kind of game that if you take the time to learn, and level, you will be able to do pretty much whatever you do and have fun. It is definitely best played with friends, or members of the community. The thing is, like most alphas, you have to remember there will be bugs. No game breaking bugs are there right now, and they have been pretty good about addressing them. I even had a rare bug break a DLC reel, which was my fault too because I had too much line test. When I contacted support they immediately helped me out no questions asked. The community of this game is better than any other I have been a part of by a landslide. Everyone is helpful, the streamers are all cool, and everyone is actively trying to improve the game. The developers do something amazing too. They listen to the community, and even work closely with them, like with the upcoming tournament they are putting on for real life prizes.The game has a TON of cool things they are bringing in the future, and the beauty of it is, they aren't just blowing smoke. They are putting out legitimate dates they want to release additions, and they follow up. If every alpha game followed up like they do, they wouldn't stay alpha.All in all, I absolutely love this game. I can just relax, put on some music, hang out with friends and catch fish. I look forward to what they are adding, and enjoy what they have already. I highly recommend at least trying the game, which can't hurt anything because it's free to play. There is another beauty, it's not P2W. This is a true F2P game that the only reason you would invest in is if you want some cool DLC they release, and want to support the game.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Honestly some of the best fishing I've ever seen in a game. Techniques can be used that I use out on the real water as well.It's not chocked full of action. It's no "WoW Killer", but if you like to fish, this game has it. For an Early Access game, it feels more polished than others. Can be confusing for players who never have spent a second on a pond or lake fishing.  The lure/bait types, the rods/reels, water temps and weather conditions. All of these affact how well you do. Patience is key to catching a lot of fish.  Excellent Fishing Sim! Just wish it had more Force Feedback capability. Tough to feel like i really caught a 3lb bass or 8 lb catfish and my arms arent tired. Also being able to move while fighting a big fish would be nice. IRL I have never been confined to the one spot im in...if I need to move I gotta move.9/10 for a fishing game for sure!

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								At the start, I hated the game, because it takes so long to make it to a level that you can actually catch some "real fish", like Pike and Muskie, instead of constantly sunfish, Crappie and Bluegill. But once you've made it up to higher levels and upgraded your tackle, the game is fantastic and very fun. The only times I hate, is when the makers of the game do upgrades or add a new map, sometimes it screws up things on other maps and the way your lures work, and sometimes you won't get any fish on lakes that you regularly get tons of fish. Also, it seems like it's the same favored people catching the biggest fish on every map, or the same people getting Unique fish on every map, when I'm using the exact gear and bait, and fishing in the same place as them. Other than these issues, the game is great and the graphics really make you feel like your fishing outside -- the water glistens, the birds are chirping, the weather changes while you're standing there from sunny to partly cloudy to cloudy to rain - and the fish change their eating times in these conditions too. If you love fishing, be very patient at the start and you will love the game.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best Fishing Simulator I have seen. Edit 13-03-2016 after update.....Let me add my 20c for what it’s worth. Use it or don’t up to you.Pos,Good to see an update in the game and to see us going somewhere in the game.I like the idea of you not being able to spam the right mouse key anymore.Realism in using your rod and reel in fish fighting is defiantly improved.Walk around lakes is an awesome idea "just make sure there is fish to catch at the new spots"Neg,Why increase the lure size on rods like Galaxy Cast 140, 160, 180 if there are no lures for them in the shop? “My Christmas DLC Rods I paid for are now useless due to this increase in lure size. Wear rate on line is still too much you can’t land a Trophy Garr with any Match Rod setup your line gets warn out before you land the fish. When are we going to see a stronger match rod, there is really a need for one now.Wear on Crank Baits!! WTH Chaps!!and then you split them all up and now they just taking up all my slots in my bag. Dev need to find another way to deal with this or remove wear on cranks completely. Crank baits should last you longer than spinners BTW.Rod and Reals don’t wear in one fishing trip, or for that matter a 100 fishing trips. The game really need some improvement here. Yes I agree Reels need a service every now and then but Rod's? How will you have wear on them? I’m quite sure Rod and Real Builders will not be advertising…..“Great Reel Will Last you a Full Day’s Of Fishing” Come-on Guy’s think things over man.A final taught…. From Yoda!Guy's don’t over complicate the game, Complication Leeds to frustration, Frustration leads to boredom, and Boredom leads to the Dark side! ps: If you release an Ultra-Light DLC make sure I can replace the lure items lost in the store, Ultra-light anglers will tell you, you will lose much more Lures than regular anglers. Well I'm done ♥♥♥♥♥in and complaining for now. Still a game I will play but we need some more patching here.Rg, Catfish Joe

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best Fishing Simulator I have seen. Edit 13-03-2016 after update.....Let me add my 20c for what it’s worth. Use it or don’t up to you.Pos,Good to see an update in the game and to see us going somewhere in the game.I like the idea of you not being able to spam the right mouse key anymore.Realism in using your rod and reel in fish fighting is defiantly improved.Walk around lakes is an awesome idea "just make sure there is fish to catch at the new spots"Neg,Why increase the lure size on rods like Galaxy Cast 140, 160, 180 if there are no lures for them in the shop? “My Christmas DLC Rods I paid for are now useless due to this increase in lure size. Wear rate on line is still too much you can’t land a Trophy Garr with any Match Rod setup your line gets warn out before you land the fish. When are we going to see a stronger match rod, there is really a need for one now.Wear on Crank Baits!! WTH Chaps!!and then you split them all up and now they just taking up all my slots in my bag. Dev need to find another way to deal with this or remove wear on cranks completely. Crank baits should last you longer than spinners BTW.Rod and Reals don’t wear in one fishing trip, or for that matter a 100 fishing trips. The game really need some improvement here. Yes I agree Reels need a service every now and then but Rod's? How will you have wear on them? I’m quite sure Rod and Real Builders will not be advertising…..“Great Reel Will Last you a Full Day’s Of Fishing” Come-on Guy’s think things over man.A final taught…. From Yoda!Guy's don’t over complicate the game, Complication Leeds to frustration, Frustration leads to boredom, and Boredom leads to the Dark side! ps: If you release an Ultra-Light DLC make sure I can replace the lure items lost in the store, Ultra-light anglers will tell you, you will lose much more Lures than regular anglers. Well I'm done ♥♥♥♥♥in and complaining for now. Still a game I will play but we need some more patching here.Rg, Catfish Joe
